sentences.en: Ever since I spoke up, my colleagues ostracize me.
sentences.cn: 从我一开始说话我的同事就让我闭嘴.

sentences.en: He was ostracized by the other students.
sentences.cn: 他受到其他学生的排斥。

sentences.en: She claims she's being ostracized by some members of her local community.
sentences.cn: 她声称遭到自己所在社区的一些成员排斥。

sentences.en: She was afraid that if she spoke up her colleagues would ostracize her.
sentences.cn: 她担心，如果她说出来，同事们就会孤立她。

sentences.en: What are we to do when others ridicule andsubtly ostracize us?
sentences.cn: 当别人讥笑或者排斥我们的时候,我们该怎麽做哪?

words.tran_cn: （古希腊）贝壳放逐法；排斥（等于ostracize）
放逐；排斥；按贝壳流放法放逐

trans.tran_cn: (古希腊)贝壳放逐法, 放逐, 排斥
trans.tran_en: If someone is ostracized, people deliberately behave in an unfriendly way toward them and do not allow them to take part in any of their social activities
